titleStmt.title: The West-Country jigg: or, A trenchmore galliard. See how the lads and lasses flock together, a merry makeing, like birds of a feather; here's Sam, and Sawny, gentle James and jonny [sic], with Moll and Moggy, and those girls so bonny: where they had store of mirth, and mickle laughter: therefore observe it, for the best comes after. : To a merry Scotch tune, or, Up with Aley, Aley, &c.

The West-Country jigg: or, A trenchmore galliard. See how the lads and lasses flock together, a merry makeing, like birds of a feather; here's Sam, and Sawny, gentle James and jonny [sic], with Moll and Moggy, and those girls so bonny: where they had store of mirth, and mickle laughter: therefore observe it, for the best comes after. : To a merry Scotch tune, or, Up with Aley, Aley, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. brooksby [sic], at the Golden-ball, in West-smith-field.,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Glasgow University Library.
